availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander H. Ashby (Hopkins County, Ky, blacksmith )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Whitsell Ashby. Father of Clarence Ashby and George Ashby. Blacksmith in Madisonville, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Fannie Owsley as a house servant in Madisonville in 1860. Held one enslaved person in trust for Lizzie Whitsell in Madisonville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 837.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 221B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #39488.
